alert.note: Alert for Orleans (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 24 at 3:04PM EST until December 25 at 6:17AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Burlington VT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Vermont... Barton River Near Coventry affecting Orleans County. .Snowmelt and rain from yesterday`s storm has resulted in gradual rises on the Barton River. Minor flooding is occurring. For the Lake Memphremagog...including Coventry...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Barton River Near Coventry. * WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Maple Street and River Road between Orleans and Coventry Station will flood. There will be extensive field and lowland flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM EST Saturday the stage was 8.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain near 8.1 feet through this evening and fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM EST.
